discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A: has no sense
B: spoke to spoke is not allowed and this command is used for spoke to spoke
c: makes no sense
D: most right answer as this command is needed on the hub for hub and spoke communication.

here we go again....exam topic showing B which is totally a wrong answer...D is the one for this qstn...why dont the admin update this unless its meant to create confusion...make wonder if this a valid database of exam qstns

Tricky question
hub:
interface Virtual-Template1 type tunnel
 ip unnumbered Loopback0
 ip nhrp network-id 1
 ip nhrp redirect
 tunnel protection ipsec profile default
!

spoke:
!
interface Virtual-Template1 type tunnel
 ip unnumbered Tunnel0
 ip nhrp network-id 1
 ip nhrp shortcut virtual-template 1
 ip nhrp redirect
 tunnel protection ipsec profile default
!

Unsure why the spoke has the redirect as well.

Selected Answer: B
vote for b

I think D is right. Because Spoke-to-Spoke traffic is not allowed and wanted, therefore redirect is not needed. But FlexVPN uses Virtual Templates to create Virtual Access interfaces for each connected Spoke.

comments.content: the question stated that spoke-to-spoke traffic is not needed
"On a FlexVPN hub-and-spoke topology where spoke-to-spoke tunnels are not allowed, which command is needed for the hub"

questions.question_text: On a FlexVPN hub-and-spoke topology where spoke-to-spoke tunnels are not allowed, which command is needed for the hub to be able to terminate FlexVPN tunnels?
Which redundancy protocol must be implemented for IPsec stateless failover to work?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. IPsec failover fallsinto two categories:statelessfailover and stateful failover.Statelessfailover uses protocols
such as the Hot Standby Router Protocol (HSRP) to provide primary-to-secondary cutover and also allows
the active and standby VPN gateways to share a common virtual IP address.

questions.question_text: Which technology works with IPsec stateful failover?

discussion.content: It is not GRE that is a tunnel type

questions.question_text: What are two functions of ECDH and ECDSA? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:

C and D
ECDH key exchange
ECDSA Digital Signature

discussion.content: ECDSA is a signature algorithm. The answer is B
